wikitext.*:
'''''brannon''''' is a [[Sindarin]]<ref group=note>The word does not appear in the [[canon]]ical texts as Sindarin; it is listed as [[Noldorin]].</ref> word meaning "lord".<ref name=LR351/>
==Etymology==

*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[BARAT|BARÁD]].<ref name=LR351>{{LR|Etymologies}} p. 351</ref>

''brannon'' could be analyzed as ''[[brand (word)#Exilic Noldorin|brand]]'' ("high, noble") and the masculine ending ''[[-on]]''.<ref group=note>Suggestion by [[User:Sage]].</ref>

==Inspiration==
In Welsh, ''[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/brenin brenin]'' means "king".

==See also==
*''[[brennil]]'' ("lady")
*''[[hîr]]'' ("master, lord")
